title: How to Rename AirPods or AirPods Pro + Troubleshooting Tips

steps.title: Connect your AirPods to your device.
steps.content: Connect your AirPods to your device. This can be your iPhone or iPad. [1] X Research source

steps.title: On your device, open the Settings app.
steps.content: On your device, open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon.

steps.title: Tap your AirPods.
steps.content: Tap your AirPods. This will be near the top of your screen. If you don't see your AirPods, tap Bluetooth .

steps.title: Tap More Info (i).
steps.content: Tap More Info (i) . This will be next to the AirPods' name.

steps.title: Tap the current name.
steps.content: Tap the current name. You'll find this at the top.

steps.title: Enter a new name and tap Done.
steps.content: Enter a new name and tap Done . The new name will be saved. If you don't see Done , tap the back arrow.

steps.title: Connect your AirPods
steps.content: Connect your AirPods to your Mac. Make sure Bluetooth is enabled on your computer or laptop.

steps.title: Click the Apple menu and select System Settings.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu and select System Settings . On older versions, this will be System Preferences .

steps.title: Click Bluetooth.
steps.content: Click Bluetooth . This is in the left panel. You may need to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Click i next to your AirPods.
steps.content: Click i next to your AirPods. You should see it listed below My Devices .

steps.title: Click the current name.
steps.content: Click the current name. You may also see Rename .

steps.title: Enter a new name and click Done.
steps.content: Enter a new name and click Done . The new name will be saved.

steps.title: Connect your AirPods to your Android device.
steps.content: Connect your AirPods to your Android device. Make sure you have Bluetooth enabled.

steps.title: Open the settings app.
steps.content: Open the settings app. You can find this in your app drawer.

steps.title: Tap Bluetooth.
steps.content: Tap Bluetooth . On some devices, this may be Connections .

steps.title: Tap the cog icon next to your AirPods.
steps.content: Tap the cog icon next to your AirPods. You should see it listed along with your other Bluetooth devices.

steps.title: Tap Rename.
steps.content: Tap Rename . This may also look like a pencil icon.

steps.title: Enter a new name and tap Save.
steps.content: Enter a new name and tap Save . The new name will be saved.

steps.title: Let your AirPods charge.
steps.content: Let your AirPods charge. If you're unable to change the name, or if you can't get your AirPods to connect, let them charge for an hour first.

steps.title: Reset your AirPods.
steps.content: Reset your AirPods. When you reset your AirPods , you'll need to pair them to your devices again. To reset, open the AirPod case. Press and hold the setup button on the back of the case until the light blinks amber, and then white. To set it up again, Storzi advises to "open the airpods case next to your phone. A dialog box will appear on your iPhone prompting you to connect to them. Click connect and thatâ€™s all."
